en: Wisdom hath builded her house; She hath hewn out her seven pillars:
hmr: Varna chun a in chu a bâwl a, A lungban pasarihai chu a phun tah a.

en: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; She hath also furnished her table:
hmr: A ranhai chu a that a, a uoin chu a chawkpawl tah a, A dawkân khawm chu a siemrêl ta bawk a.

en: She hath sent forth her maidens; She crieth upon the highest places of the city:
hmr: A nunghâkhai chu a tir suok a, Khawpui hmun insângtakhaia chun an khêk a,

en: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: As for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,
hmr: “Tukhawm mi mâwl chu hi tieng hin hung raw se,” tiin. Hrietthiemna boa um ta ding chun, a kuomah a hril a,

en: Come, eat ye of my bread, And drink of the wine which I have mingled.
hmr: “Hung la, ka bei hung fa la, Ka uoin chawkpawl chu hung dâwn rawh.

en: Leave off, ye simple ones, and live; And walk in the way of understanding.
hmr: Nang mi mâwl, mâwlna chu mâksanin khawsa la, Hrietthiemna lampui chu hung hraw rawh,” tiin.

en: He that correcteth a scoffer getteth to himself reviling; And he that reproveth a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
hmr: Hmusittu siemṭhatu chun inzakna a hmu hlak a; Mi khawhlo kâwktu chun kut thlâkna a tuok hlak.

en: Reprove not a scoffer, lest he hate thee: Reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.
hmr: Hmusittu chu kâwk naw rawh, chuong naw chun, theida rawi a ti che. Mi var chu kâwk la, ama chun hmangai a ti che.

en: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
hmr: Mi var kuoma chun inchûktirna pe la, ama chu hung var nâwk sawt a ta, Mi fel chu inchûktir la, ama chu thiemnaa chun hung pung a tih.

en: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
hmr: LALPA ṭi chu varna bul a nih, Mi Inthieng hrietna chu hrietthiemna bul a ni bawk.

en: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, And the years of thy life shall be increased.
hmr: Keimaa chun i nihai chu belsa nîng a ta, I dam sûng kumhai chu sukpung nîng an tih.

en: If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself; And if thou scoffest, thou alone shalt bear it.
hmr: I var chun, nangma ta dinga var i na, I hmusit chun, nangma ngeiin phur i tih.

en: The foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knoweth nothing.
hmr: Nuhmei invêt chu a hmûr a thiem a, Ama chu a mâwl a, iengkhawm a hriet nawh.

en: And she sitteth at the door of her house, On a seat in the high places of the city,
hmr: A in kawtkhâra chun a ṭhung a, Khawpui hmun insânghaia ṭhungnaa chun,

en: To call to them that pass by, Who go right on their ways:
hmr: Mi fe inlawnhai ko dingin, Chuong an lampuia fe peihai chu,

en: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither; And as for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,
hmr: “Tukhawm mi mâwl chu, hi tieng hung raw se,” tiin. Hrietthiemna boa um ta ding chun a hril a:

en: Stolen waters are sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
hmr: “Tui inrûkhai chu a thlum a, Fienriela bei fâk chu ân hnik bawk a,” tiin.

en: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mithihai chu chutaka chun an um ti a hriet nawh a, Amanu mikhuolhai khawm chu Seol lipuia chun an um ti a hriet bawk nawh.
